intro: Gyrostachys cinnabarina, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous leaflets and produces small, hard pods containing seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in woodworking, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
